message.content:
A gorilla is a large and powerful ape that is native to Africa.
It has a dark colored fur that can range from black to reddish-brown.
The fur of a gorilla is thick and shaggy, with longer hair on the back.
They have broad and muscular shoulders, with a noticeable sagittal crest on the skull.
The arms of a gorilla are longer than its legs, and they have opposable thumbs.
Gorillas are typically found in dense forests and mountainous regions.
They are herbivorous, and their diet primarily consists of leaves, fruit, and stems.
